name: Live Like Local
description:
Step away from the city and into the heart of village life at Thagatti Village, nestled in the serene Melagiri Hills. This 2-day, 1-night retreat offers a deeply immersive experience rooted in local stories, traditions, and community living.
Reconnect with the land and embrace the pace of rural life with:
-bamboo basket making workshop
-foraging and cooking session
- permaculture farming walk
- a sunset hike and peaceful stream dips
- a slow-paced village walk guided by Madhan, your local host and naturalist, who brings the culture to life in Hindi, English, Tamil, and Kannada.
Stay in a cozy bamboo hut, savor home-cooked farm meals, and soak in bonus seasonal experiences like a local Kannada play or village festivals, depending on the time of year.
Perfect for those seeking meaningful travel, this retreat prioritizes people over places and stories over itineraries. Limited spots. Fixed menu. Deep connection.
Contact: Vaishnavi- 8796233031

name: Water Days – Author Discussion
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. We are given a sense of how untrammeled urbanization has turned the local administration rogue and uncaring. All along, men and women line up to collect water and stories in the dead of night. 

Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.

name: Book Discussion : WATER DAYS with Sundar Sarukkai and Srikar Raghavan
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.

name: Screening of Before Film Series by Richard Linklater - Before Sunrise (1995)
description:
Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!

What is the Before series?

Richard Linklater’s trilogy of Before Sunrise, Before Sunset, and Before Midnight tells the heartfelt, surprising tale of the joys and pains of modern love.

The films, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, follow the evolving relationship of Jesse and Celine over a period of 18 years. Each film is set about nine years apart, capturing different stages of their lives and relationship. It's widely considered one the greatest film trilogies, and is notable for its extensive use of dialogue, with conversations driving the narrative and exploring themes of love, time, and relationships. The films are characterized by long, intimate conversations between the main characters, which often delve into their thoughts, feelings, and philosophies.

name: Screening of Before Film Series by Richard Linklater - Before Sunset (2004)
description:
Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!

name: Manga Reading Room with Ishan
description:
We’re starting a manga library and reading room!

Come enjoy a quiet environment where you can browse and read from our collection of manga, and connect with fellow enthusiasts from the community.

If you’ve never read manga before and are just curious about the hype, this is a great place to start!

Please note: Books cannot be borrowed or taken outside the library. Since these are from a personal collection, access is limited to the duration of the event.
Who is Ishan?

Ishan is an avid manga reader, game master, and all-around fandom enthusiast. He wants more people to fall in love with the things he loves, and this event is his way of sharing his large manga collection with the community.

name: Improv Essentials: A Crash Course by Improv Lore
description:
Want to improvise but keep missing our Level 1 intensive? Learn the basics in our crash course!

We’ll take you from no performing experience to loving the stage
What we’ll cover:

    Basic stagecraft

    Trusting your ideas

    Working (playing) well with others

    Short-form improv games

    An introduction to longform improv

What you get:

    6 hours of workshop

    Access to select cast-only jams

    A discount on the next Level 1 intensive

Schedule:

Day 1: Saturday, 16th August - 11am to 2pm
Day 2: Sunday, 17th August - 11am to 2pm

name: Phir Bhi Quiz Hai Hindustani
description:
From the Mughals to Modi, from traffic to the Taj, no chapters have been removed from QPQ’s India Quiz. Come prove you are the best this Friday at 5 PM

About Quiz Pro Quo?

QPQ is a community to introduce people to quizzing. They come together every week to crack questions on everyday topics. They have been hosting quizzes online and in person since May 2020.

name: Yoga with Sisters & Misters
description:
Yoga - With the Sisters and Misters
PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN MATS :))
Progressive Vinyasa classes with Chanchal are a blend of breath work, strong but approachable flow, mindful postural focus, and deep soothing support.
Classes cultivate balance, stability, flexibility, mobility and vigor as the asana ebbs and flows between effort and ease.
Students can expect a mix of both traditional lineage based practices & progressive movement intended for modern bodies and demands.
Yoga Instructor: Chanchal
Meeting time: 8:15 
Meeting Point: CCD Square
For any further queries contact
Vaishnavi- 6380349608

name: Visible Mending 101
description:
You can bring something you’d like to mend, or practice on fabric scraps as we explore simple techniques like darning, and patchwork.

Visible mending shows that repairing is not just practical, but beautiful. It's a way to care for our clothes, extend their life, and add a touch of personality and colour along the way.

All materials will be provided, but feel free to bring your own garment to work on.

name: Zines for Safer Futures
description:
✨ Zine-making x Safe Futures ✨

What does safety feel like?
A hand to hold, a route you trust, a number you always text.
This workshop is a space to remember, reimagine, and reclaim.

We’re bringing back #TextWhenYouGetHome, not just as a phrase, but as a movement.

Through scissors, glue, stories, and stillness, we’ll make zines that hold the textures of our experiences and futures we want to shape.
Come reflect, create, and connect.

🎨 No art skills needed
🧵 Just show up with your stories, your feelings, your questions

👀 Limited spots. Link in bio to sign up

name: Paper making workshop from fibre to sheet
description: Experience the process behind Oorjaa’s banana fibre paper, a material made in-house from agricultural waste. This hands-on session allows participants to work alongside artisans to observe how pulp is transformed into sheets of textured paper. Dive into a creative exploration and gain insights into sustainable practices while creating your very own paper.

name: Vintage Car Rally
description: Celebrate the spirit of freedom with a Vintage Car Rally featuring a display of vintage cars and bikes. Relive the past this Independence Day!

name: Threads of India
description: Uthhan's artisan-made crafts and treasures are showcased at Forum South Bengaluru. This event highlights the beauty and skill of handcrafted items, offering a unique shopping experience.

name: The Boys Dance Workshop
description: A three-day immersive dance camp featuring non-stop dance and a masterclass from one of India's OGs, Das The Way Baby. The camp focuses on feeling and living the vibe, not just learning steps. Early bird and day pass options are available.

name: Independence Day Flag Hoisting
description: Bengaluru will host Independence Day celebrations at the Field Marshal Manekshaw Parade Ground. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will hoist the national flag, review a parade, receive a guard of honor, and deliver a speech. A cultural program, ‘Swatantra Sangramada Veera Kannadathiyaru,’ highlighting the role of Karnataka women in the freedom struggle, will be presented by students, along with other performances. Elaborate security arrangements are in place.

location.name: Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground
location.address: Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground, Bangalore

name: Indie Fridays ft. Felt Tip Pencils
description: Felt Tip Pencils is a three-piece indie band from India making music that blends blues, funk, and a bit of rock 'n' roll attitude. It's Ritom on vocals and bass, Venkat on guitar, and Rudiro on drums — just three friends writing music that grooves and feels good to play. They're not trying to be fancy — just writing songs that you'll actually remember. Stuff you can move to, vibe with, or play on a loop. Check out their latest song on YouTube.

name: The Starry Stretch
description: An innovative exhibition that immerses visitors in Van Gogh's masterpieces through stunning visuals and immersive technology, creating a sensory experience.

name: Handlooms - Past, Present & Future
description: A panel discussion exploring the past, present, and future of Kadambari handlooms as part of the River Weaves: Brocades of Banaras exhibition. Speakers include Laila Tyabji, Ratna Krishna Kumar, Nandita Das, Chandra Jain, and Shoba Narayan.

name: Animal Farm
description: A captivating theatre production bringing to life George Orwell's classic tale through powerful performances and engaging storytelling.

name: The Human Festival
description: Human Festival is an initiative by Smileys to celebrate the human spirit by breaking stereotypes. As a part of their initiative to facilitate an inclusive environment and culture, the folks running the festival are celebrating Independence Day with persons with disability. Expect flea stalls, food stalls, human treasure hunts, social dances and open mic sessions. Spend Independence Day here making merry and celebrating inclusivity.

name: Bengaluru International Short Film Festival (BISFF)
description: The Bengaluru International Short Film Festival (BISFF) offers a diverse program of short films, showcasing both established and emerging filmmakers. The festival provides a platform for cinematic innovation and artistic expression, fostering dialogue and appreciation for the art form. Delegate registration grants access to screenings and events.

name: Karaoke Night
description: Celebrate India's Independence Day with a karaoke night at LICK, hosted by Josh Selvaraj. Enjoy good vibes, great voices, and gelato.

name: The Prophet and the Poet
description: The Prophet and the Poet is an internationally acclaimed play developed by the Bangalore Little Theatre (BLT). Based on the exchange of letters and articles between Mahatma Gandhi and Rabindranath Tagore over 25 years, with the Indian freedom struggle as the backdrop, the play reveals how the two personalities differed significantly on many matters, including the form and content of the freedom movement. Despite their deep differences, they maintained genuine respect and love for each other. The play has been used in senior-level leadership development programs, focusing on creating a culture of maturity in internal and external transactions. The Bangalore Little Theatre has performed the play for the President of India and at locations associated with Gandhi and Tagore. In 2014, Prasar Bharati commissioned a telefilm on the play.

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️
